TopicTitle: Can We Get the "React" Teens to Play KSP?

Articles.Content:
I watch YouTube a lot, and one of my favorite channels if TheFineBros. Their popular series "React" just got it's own channel, and one of the weekly shows there is a gaming reaction. They choose which game the react teens play by listening to what lots of people are suggesting them to play. So, if we contact them enough and tell them to play KSP they just might do it! I, personally, would be ecstatic if they played KSP.

So I was curious, do you guys want them to play KSP? If you do, and if you also have a YouTube/Facebook/Twitter account, leaving a comment on their pages is your best bet. You don't have to do this, only if you want to.
"X react to", where X is kids, teens or elders, would be to KSP as a huge booster is to a rocket. If they do this, KSP will experience an incredible surge in popularity. Great idea.

Can you imagine all the 12 year olds, complaining about minor bugs?

Sounds good for $$$, buuut...

What I see with the vocal majority of our generation is a general lack of interest in spaceflight. Last week I showed one of my cousins a picture of the Apollo 15 LRV, she just told me it was all filned in a desert and continued to chat on Facebook.

Sad, but true, sometimes some of my classmates laughed at me because I'm interested in spaceflight and engineering, I don't mind what they say. By the way those classmates smoke, drink alcohol...

Back on topic: Not a bad idea.

No. Please no. I don't like these series at all. This would give KSP some attention, but maybe you'll get the wrong audience target.

And if I look to my classmates... No.

It would be like if pewdiepie plays this game, but then a little different.
They wouldn't get it, it's such a niche audience

I personally believe that the amount of publicity we have right now is good enough. Games that have a slow growing and tightly knit community of dedicated players are usually the ones with the best communities.
